column1: Airways and lungs - Difficulty breathing - Rapid breathing Eyes, ears, nose, and throat - Severe pain in the throat - Severe pain or burning in the nose, eyes, ears, lips, or tongue - Loss of vision - Throat swelling (which may also cause breathing difficulty) Stomach and intestines - Severe abdominal pain - Vomiting - Burns of the food pipe (esophagus) - Vomiting blood - Blood in the stool Heart and blood vessels - Low blood pressure (develops rapidly) - Collapse Skin - Irritation - Burns - Holes in the skin or tissues under the skin
How well a person does depends on the amount of poison they swallowed and how quickly they receive treatment.
